  The f5distributedcloud_forward_proxy_policy resource manages Forward Proxy Policies in F5 Distributed Cloud.
  Forward Proxy Policies define rules for controlling outbound traffic from applications through the F5 XC proxy.
  Example Usage
  
  resource "f5distributedcloud_forward_proxy_policy" "example" {
    name      = "my-proxy-policy"
    namespace = "my-namespace"
  
    proxy_rules {
      action       = "allow"
      domain_match = "*.example.com"
      port_match   = 443
      http_methods = ["GET", "POST"]
    }
  
    proxy_rules {
      action       = "deny"
      domain_match = "*.blocked.com"
    }
  }
---

# f5distributedcloud_forward_proxy_policy (Resource)

The `f5distributedcloud_forward_proxy_policy` resource manages Forward Proxy Policies in F5 Distributed Cloud.

Forward Proxy Policies define rules for controlling outbound traffic from applications through the F5 XC proxy.

## Example Usage

```hcl
resource "f5distributedcloud_forward_proxy_policy" "example" {
  name      = "my-proxy-policy"
  namespace = "my-namespace"

  proxy_rules {
    action       = "allow"
    domain_match = "*.example.com"
    port_match   = 443
    http_methods = ["GET", "POST"]
  }

  proxy_rules {
    action       = "deny"
    domain_match = "*.blocked.com"
  }
}
```



<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String)
- `namespace` (String)

### Optional

- `description` (String)
- `proxy_rules` (Block List) Proxy rule configuration. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--proxy_rules))

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The ID of this resource.

<a id="nestedblock--proxy_rules"></a>
### Nested Schema for `proxy_rules`

Required:

- `action` (String) Action to take (allow/deny).

Optional:

- `domain_match` (String) Domain pattern to match (supports wildcards).
- `http_methods` (List of String) HTTP methods to match.
- `port_match` (Number) Port number to match.
